Package xxl.core.spatial.cursors

Provides mappers for different type of Point and Rectangle objects as well as several join algorithms: nested loops distance similarity-join for Points, the spatial join algorithm based on space-filling curves proposed by Jack Orenstein, similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" and hash-based plane sweep for two-dimensional data.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GESS
    This class provides the similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" (see "[DS 01] GESS: a Scalable Algorithm for Mining Large Datasets in High Dimensional Spaces by Jens-Peter Dittrich and Bernhard Seeger, ACM SIGKDD 2001." for a detailed description of this method).
    GESS.ReferencePointMethod
    This class provides the Reference Point Method of GESS.
    IndexedNestedLoopsJoin
    A simple IndexedNestedLoopsJoin-operator: The given RTree-index processes a window query for each KPE-object of the input iterator.
    KPEInputCursor
    The KPEInputCursor constructs an Iterator of KPEs for a given flat File containing KPE-Objects.
    Mappers
    This class provides several static methods returning suitable Mappers for the spatial context.
    MSJ
    This class provides the MSJ (Multidimensional Spatial Join) similarity-join algorithm proposed by Koudas and Sevick in "[KS 98] Nick Koudas, Kenneth C.
    MSJ.MSJSorter
    This class provides the I/O-strategy of MSJ
    NestedLoopsJoin
    NestedLoops distance similarity-join for Points.
    Orenstein
    The spatial join algorithm based on space-filling curves proposed by Jack Orenstein.
    Orenstein.Counter
    A class for counting
    Orenstein.OrensteinSA<T>
    The sweep area used by the Orenstein algorithm.
    PlaneSweep
    Plane Sweep for two-dimensional data.
    PlaneSweep.KPEPlaneSweepComparator
    Compares two Objects with respect to the first dimension of ther left borders in ascending order.
    PlaneSweep.PlaneSA
    A SweepArea based on hash-buckets
    PlaneSweep.PlaneSweepComparator
    Compares two Objects with respect to a user specified dimension of their left or right borders in ascending order.
    PointInputCursor
    The PointInputCursor constructs an Iterator of Points for a given flat File of Point-Objects.
    RectangleInputIterator
    The RectangleInputIterator constructs an Iterator of rectangles for a given flat File of Rectangle-Objects.
    RectangleUniverseDouble
    The RectangleUniverseDouble computes the universe (Minimal Bounding Rectangle, MBR or MBB) for an Iterator of DoublePoints.
    RectangleUniverseDouble.UniverseFunction
    The aggregate function that computes the actual MBR.
    Replicator
    The Replicator provides the replication engine of GESS.
    Replicator.MaxGeneration
    Allows at most bound generations (2^(generation) replicates are created).
    Replicator.MaxReplicates
    Constrains replication to 'bound' replicates per input-element.
    Replicator.MaxSplitBit
    Allows splits if the actual bitIndex is greater or equal than a given bound.
    Replicator.MaxSplitLevel
    Allows splits if the level is smaller or equal than a given bitIndex.
    Replicator.MaxSplitsPerLevel
    Allows at most bound splits per level.
    Replicator.QueueEl
    A Wrapper-class needed to unwind the recursive split.
    Replicator.Split
    Abstract Predicate used to decide whether further splits are allowed.
    RTreeJoin
    This is one implementation of the R-Tree-Join-Algorithms proposed in [BKS 93] (see "[BKS 93] Efficient Processing of Spatial Joins by Thomas Brinkhoff, Hans-Peter Kriegel and Bernhard Seeger, ACM SIGMOD 1993." for a detailed description of this method).
    UniverseDouble
    The UniverseDouble computes the universe (Minimal Bounding Rectangle, MBR or MBB) for an Iterator of DoublePoints.
    UniverseDouble.UniverseFunction
    The aggregate function that computes the actual MBR.
    UniverseFloat
    The UniverseFloat computes the universe (Minimal Bounding Rectangle, MBR or MBB) for an Iterator of FloatPoints.
    UniverseFloat.UniverseFunction
    The aggregate function that computes the actual MBR.

Package xxl.core.spatial.cursors Description

Provides mappers for different type of Point and Rectangle objects as well as several join algorithms: nested loops distance similarity-join for Points, the spatial join algorithm based on space-filling curves proposed by Jack Orenstein, similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" and hash-based plane sweep for two-dimensional data.
